. Grounds open dawn to dusk year round. Franklin D. Roosevelt's summer island home. Administered by a commission composed of members from both the United States and Canada. The park is owned, funded, and staffed by people from both countries. The Park Commission website
is an important reference. Passport required.

name=West Quoddy Lighthouse and Visitor Center

content=South Lubec Road. Memorial Day Weekend to mid-October 10:10AM-4PM. Picturesque red-striped lighthouse is the most eastern in the US. Visitor center is housed in the 1858 lighthouse keeper's quarters. Exhibits and docents. Nice picnic area and views. Free.
content=Cove Road. June-Sept W-Su 11AM-4PM. Original weaving, knitting, local photography.
address=135 Main Street at the Lubec Historical Society
content=Tourist information, local tours, Historical Society Museum
directions=On South Lubec Road heading towards West Quoddy Head Lighthouse.

content=The South Lubec Sand Bar is debatably one of the top ten places to bird in Maine.  It has extensive mudflats surrounding the site, which provide feeding and roosting habitat for a wide variety of shorebirds and is an important stopover for migratory birds.  A wonderful destination for birding enthusiasts!
content=May 15-October 15. Four and one-half miles of trails on over 500 acres. Forest, coastal and bog trails. Fee charged.
name=The Mary Potterton Memorial Free Concert Series
content=At the Congregational Church. Wednesdays at 7:30PM from the last Wednesday in June, through the last Wednesday in August.
Cross-Country Skiing, Snowmobiling, Ice Fishing, Snowshoeing.
content=Local tours including history of Lubec and Campobello, Intertidal Shore, Bogs and the Ice Age, Lighthouses, Tide Mill Organic Farm

content=Visit Mowry Beach and Pike Lands Conservation Areas located in Lubec and are open to hiking and daytime non-motorized use.  Get your copy of the “Cobscook Trails” a guide to hiking in the area.  Please contact us for more information. QRLT is a non-profit conservation organization.
directions=downtown , part of Lubec Landmarks and the McCurdy Smokehouse Complex
content=Gallery showings of area artists and craftspeople. Gift shop features local and maritime gifts . Jewelry,hand made craft items, art , and yarns.
content=Open Year Round, - Call for reservations.
name=The Home Port Inn and Restaurant
directions=One Mile Before Quoddy Head State Park on the Left

content=The Easternmost Gift Shop in the United States. Specializing West Quoddy and other lighthouse souvenirs, gifts, gourmet foods, local crafts. One of a kind tees and sweats with our own designs.
directions=One Mile Before Quoddy Head State Park on the Left

content=The Easternmost Gift Shop in the United States! Specializing in West Quoddy and area lighthouse souvenirs and gifts, gourmet foods, books, local crafts.  One of a kind tees and sweatshirts with our own designs that you will not find anywhere else in the world! Courteous friendly service, in business since 1990!
content=Crow Town Gallery is currently featuring the works of Lubec artist Bonnie Beard has well as hosting musical events produced by Cobscook Bay Music
content=Vacation rentals at restored Coast Guard Station. Beautiful views from your perch on the easternmost point.
content=Open Year Round, www.cohillsinn.com - Call for reservations.
content=Lovely vacation homes. Oceanside, oceanview, village and remote available in Lubec and surrounding area.
address=450 South Lubec Road, Lubec,  ME 04652

content=A Classic Maine seaside cottage on 3 oceanfront acres of lush meadows and wild flowers.  Sleeps 4 - 2 bedrooms; 2 baths.  Spectacular views from deck, balcony and seaside sitting area that is adjacent to a renowned birding reserve. Private artist studio on property.  Close to West Quoddy Head Lighthouse and State Park, Downtown Lubec and Campobello Island, CAN.  An extraordinary cottage that you will look forward to returning to after a day of adventure!

content=Offering Quality Vacation Rental Homes  –  14 rental homes in Lubec. Prices range from $450 to $1,500 per week. Properties range from sandy beach front apartment, to secluded saltwater farm estate, to grand Victorian style, to simple cottages, to cozy log cabins, to ocean front New Englanders.  Properties rent by the week during summer. Some are also available by the day, month, or season during spring, fall and winter months. Enjoy the comfort of having your own “home” on the shore while visiting beautiful Down East Maine.

content=Comfortable self-catering accommodations on a tree-lined street in the center of the village, close to all amenities and SummerKeys.  Available as an apartment with three bedrooms, kitchenette, two lounges, and full bath, or by the room.  Off street parking, use of laundry facilities included.  Moderate rates, discounts for 5 or more nights, also for off-season stays.
